name: Littledata
description:
Littledata radically simplifies web performance tracking by translating Google Analytics data into a stream of actionable and summarised reports. No more complex charts, 'dashboard widgets' and wasting hours on looking through hundreds of Google Analytics reports!

Free tool for SMEs to track web conversion, with premium subscription features to simplify setup and monitoring of ecommerce, custom dimensions and events.

We also provide expert analytics advice and custom web analytics setup to help businesses understand their customers’ online behaviour and achieve business goals.

team.title: Cofounder/VP Marketing
team.name: Ari Messer
team.bioHtml: Doer & Thinker @Littledata - London | NYC | California - @Stanford @University of Edinburgh

team.name: Edward Upton
team.bioHtml: Founder @Littledata, @Teachable, strategy & product consultant. Product manager @Macmillan Publishers. Trained at Accenture, MA from Magdalen College, Oxford.

team.title: Product Manager
team.name: Chaitanya Nijhara
team.bioHtml: I am a passionate Product Manager and a self-starter with a proven track record of shipping products from conceptualization to launch.

jobs.title: Lead Software Developer
jobs.description:
Location: Bucharest, Romania (remote working possible)


Littledata’s app provides automated insights for eCommerce – translating web analytics into actionable insights for growing companies. Our software is in use by thousands of companies globally, and our development team is growing to keep up with the demand for new features.

We need an experienced coder to execute on our roadmap – building fast, robust software for data integrations. You will join a product team of 8 people based on Bucharest, Cluj, and London.

Key responsibilities:
 - Supporting developers with architecture choices and mentoring on code style and best practice.
- Adding to existing functionality built with Node, MeteorJS, and MongoDB
- Evaluating the feasibility of new features
- Researching technical best practice
- Using Kanban and Test-driven development to maintain speed

Requirements:
Experienced in building commercial web services (any language)
Familiarity with JavaScript ES6
Run an Agile process in a small team
Strong mathematical education

Benefits:
- Competitive salary
- Have more impact in a fast-moving startup team
- Fun culture in a global team
- Private health insurance
- Quarterly offsite in Europe

To apply, please email us an example of a web service you have built and your role in the development to jobs@littledata.io, and attach your CV.

jobs.title: Technical Support Rep (West Coast US hours)
jobs.description:
Location: Nashville, TN

Some remote working is possible, but you must reside in the Nashville area and be available to work in person at least two days per week.

Do you love customer support and have an aptitude for technical details?

We have an exciting opportunity to join our world-class support team and help customers get the most out of Littledata. You will solve problems every day and be a key player in customer success.

Littledata is an eCommerce analytics startup with customers in over 50 countries. Our app fixes tracking automatically and helps eCommerce sites get accurate data about their online sales and marketing. We’re growing fast and are dedicated to continuing to offer best-in-class customer support to all of our customers.

As our new Technical Support Representative, you’ll communicate daily with leads and customers in North America to help them get the most out of Littledata. You will work directly with our Customer Support Director in Nashville, help customers in the Pacific time zone, and communicate daily with our global team.

Key responsibilities:

- Responding to customer inquiries and tracking help tickets (most communication happens via email/online chat)
- Arranging calls and screen-shares with leads and customers to increase engagement and upsells
- Helping build and improve clear and useful technical documentation
- Gathering customer feedback for product development
- Encouraging online reviews

Requirements:

- 2+ years demonstrated success in a customer support role
- Experience with Google Analytics or other tracking tools
- Interest in ecommerce
- BA or equivalent

Benefits:

- Fun culture in a small, global team
- Health insurance stipend
- Annual offsite in Europe

To apply, please email us at jobs@littledata.io with a resume and cover letter.
